The album was also released as part of a CD/DVD combination, featuring the "Inside the Casket" documentary, which showed how the band recorded the album. The band toured around Europe and Japan, and ended their "Mentally Damaged Tour" in their home country of Sweden. In late January 2008, it was announced on the band's official website that guitarist Thomas Silver, would be leaving the band as he had "lost his fire and inspiration". Its features include 12 new classrooms, a new automotive technology classroom, a new library addition, new administrative offices, renovations to create new cosmetology/health care program spaces as well as improvements to kitchen, sewing/fashion areas and the construction technology space. In late March 2012, Holy Cross Catholic Secondary School launched its new website as part of a larger initiative for all schools under the administration of the Peterborough Victoria Northumberland and Clarington Catholic District School Board to have a website by 2012. content.source_3: before the kick. A number of arguments suggest that the total stellar mass would be roughly 0.1% of the mass of the SMBH or less. The biggest HCSSs would carry perhaps a few million stars, making them comparable in luminosity to a globular cluster or ultra-compact dwarf galaxy. Aside from being very compact, the main difference between an HCSS and an ordinary star cluster is the much greater mass of the HCSS, due to the SMBH at its centre.
